message.content:
cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.RO, cs.MM 

This paper proposes a framework for Multi-Object Tracking (MOT) that utilizes both short-term and long-term cues, which are commonly used in computer vision and machine learning (cs.CV). The proposed switcher-aware classification (SAC) is a novel approach that takes into consideration the potential identity-switch causer (switcher), which is a unique contribution to the field of MOT and could be of interest to researchers in artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also discusses the use of deep learning techniques, such as Single Object Tracking (SOT) and re-identification (ReID) sub-nets, which are commonly used in machine learning and deep learning (cs.LG). The proposed framework could also be of interest to researchers in robotics (cs.RO) as it could be applied to real-world scenarios. Finally, the paper evaluates the proposed method on challenging MOT benchmarks, which is a common practice in multimedia (cs.MM) research.
